page.title: 19HOW THE FARM OPERATES
page.content: The first cut is made in mid-May and the second six weeks later. From April to October the cows are in fields which are divided into paddocks. Each day they go to a fresh paddock and it is fertilised when they leave it. The land is ploughed and reseeded in a seven-year period. Milking, in the milking parlour, takes about 2 hours each morning. Records are kept of each cow's milk yield and the amount of food she is given depends on the amount of milk she gives. The milk is stored in cooler tanks until the milk tanker comes to collect it.
